intro: Loeselia ciliata subsp. echinophylla, commonly known as the hairy leaf loeselia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate climates and is found in regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It has a slender, upright stem and is often found in meadows or along stream banks. The subspecies is notable for its distinctive leaf structure and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
